channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Dodgers win Game 3 of the World Series after 18 innings
item.description: The Dodgers beat the Blue Jays in Game 3 of the World Series after a thrilling 18 innings, matching the longest game by innings in postseason history.
item.content:encoded: The Dodgers beat the Blue Jays in Game 3 of the World Series after a thrilling 18 innings, matching the longest game by innings in postseason history.
item.dc:creator: Steve Futterman

item.title: Federal food benefits will run out Nov. 1. How the nation's food banks are responding
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Claire Babineaux-Fontenot, CEO of Feeding America, about the looming expiration of federal food assistance and what it means for food banks across the country.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Claire Babineaux-Fontenot, CEO of Feeding America, about the looming expiration of federal food assistance and what it means for food banks across the country.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Trump administration expands political pressure campaign to SNAP benefits
item.description: As the government shutdown drags on, the Trump administration says Democrats will be to blame when millions of Americans will lose their SNAP benefits Nov. 1.
item.content:encoded: As the government shutdown drags on, the Trump administration says Democrats will be to blame when millions of Americans will lose their SNAP benefits Nov. 1.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: President Trump addresses troops in Japan, SNAP benefits will run out for millions of Americans Nov 1., Hurricane Melissa barrels toward Jamaica as Category 5 storm.
item.content:encoded: President Trump addresses troops in Japan, SNAP benefits will run out for millions of Americans Nov 1., Hurricane Melissa barrels toward Jamaica as Category 5 storm.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: The racial history of the 'overpopulation time bomb' and 'pronatalism' movements
item.description: Code Switch explores the racial history of two seemingly opposing movements that inform today's declining birthrates.
item.content:encoded: Code Switch explores the racial history of two seemingly opposing movements that inform today's declining birthrates.
item.dc:creator: Gene Demby

item.title: Moo-sic to their ears: Farmers find cows love jazz music
item.description: Farmers are serenading cows with smooth jazz. Studies on whether it boosts milk production are in-cow-clusive, but herds seem udderly delighted by the groovy tunes.
item.content:encoded: Farmers are serenading cows with smooth jazz. Studies on whether it boosts milk production are in-cow-clusive, but herds seem udderly delighted by the groovy tunes.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: How one school prepares kids for school shootings while protecting them from trauma
item.description: With students back in class, school shootings are on the rise. NPR's Leila Fadel visits a school in Minnesota to see how it's preparing students for the worst while trying to minimize trauma.
item.content:encoded: With students back in class, school shootings are on the rise. NPR's Leila Fadel visits a school in Minnesota to see how it's preparing students for the worst while trying to minimize trauma.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Online match programs link farmers with those looking to take on their land
item.description: Websites fashioned like online marketplaces match aspiring farmers with land owners who want to pass their property to someone who will be a good steward of their work. It's part of a growing trend.
item.content:encoded: Websites fashioned like online marketplaces match aspiring farmers with land owners who want to pass their property to someone who will be a good steward of their work. It's part of a growing trend.
item.dc:creator: Sophia Saliby

item.title: 'Our goal is to be here': Minnesota clinic provides care to an underserved population
item.description: With skepticism about vaccines on the rise, one doctor in central Minnesota is making an effort to counter misinformation in his mostly immigrant community.
item.content:encoded: With skepticism about vaccines on the rise, one doctor in central Minnesota is making an effort to counter misinformation in his mostly immigrant community.
item.dc:creator: Kirsti Marohn

item.title: Trump meets new prime minister and addresses U.S. troops in Japan
item.description: President Trump addressed U.S. troops in Japan Tuesday and met the country's new prime minister, emphasizing his "peace through strength" message.
item.content:encoded: President Trump addressed U.S. troops in Japan Tuesday and met the country's new prime minister, emphasizing his "peace through strength" message.
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram
